main event: A UFO sighting occurred in Brunswick, Georgia on March 9, 1950, where objects flying at speeds of 1,800 to 2,000 miles per hour were observed by witnesses, including experienced aviators.
interesting points: The objects were observed crossing toward the southwest and then disappearing before being discovered again going north.
Witnesses estimated that the objects were shaped like saucers, flat on the bottom, and were flying at speeds greater than any commercially known plane.
The sighting was substantiated by multiple witnesses, including retired officers, experienced aviators, and members of the Brunswick Civil Air Patrol.
The UFOs were observed by many who initially thought they were ordinary planes until they passed overhead at tremendous speed.
No photographs were included in the report, but witnesses provided detailed descriptions of the objects.
witnesses: experienced aviators, retired officers, members of the Brunswick Civil Air Patrol
